review_blob:
caramel, basement aromas, dough, raisin, brown, cloudy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

This beer was fantastic. A kind of beer youre proud to drink because its to a good cause.

First time I drank this I realized why boulevard brewery is such a successful wheat brewery. The flavor is that of lemons and citrus. Aroma is enough to get you off. For a wheat its a beautiful golden straw with a dash of orange hues.

floral, citrus, frothy, white foam, golden, amber, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, lively, 

I read about this in a beer book im reading and the first time I drank it I didnt notice the subtle pineapple taste/aroma that is magnificently blended to create a beer with a tropical explosion. Although this beer didnt pair well with my fish tacos, when drank on its own its a beer Id drink a 6 pack of easily and enjoy every sip.

light body, thin feel, fizzy, astringent, skunky, pale, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, 

This is definitely a beer that if offered to me by someone Id drink it and not be disappointed in drinking it. Honestly it seems common and nothing worth suggesting to anyone unless theyre interested in drinking beer.

It was a good example of a pale ale. It had a pleasant hop aroma and taste the biggest problem with this beer as I drank their was a bad taste in the back of my mouth. But Id still recommend this beer to pale ale drinkers.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Magic hats #9: not quite a pale ale. Love it. The hops are so subtle and pleasant to where if youre not a hop lover but want to get more exposure to hops, magic hat brings you in the hoptastic world of beer.
